font.marquee: Enrichment Packet Swap on Thursday: Wellfleet at the Post Office from 5:00-5:30pm. North Platte at the Prairie Mart from 5:00-5:30pm

div.p:
Maywood School Families,
Personal belongings of MPS students can be picked at the school this week on Wednesday and Thursday, 8:00-4:00 PM.
Bags can also be sent home to students who are receiving meals.

a.aria-label: Read more about Personal Belonging Pickup

div.p:
Elementary Students and Parents,
Our school website contains the learning links that our students use. There has been some confusion on how to log into Learning Odyssey.
1. Elementary students will select the bottom button, with the red circle, (it's the 4th one from the left).
2. Click on the button with the red circle.
3. This will opens to a . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Elementary Edgenuity/Learning Odyssey

div.p: Maywood Public School Families, Please click on this link Maywood Public School Continuity Learning to view important information and procedures pertaining to online learning environments.

a.aria-label: Read more about Maywood Public School Continuity Learning

div.p:
We didn't send Chromebooks home with elementary students because we don't have enough devices for everyone. Elementary students are getting enrichment packets that will be exchanged every Thursday. We realize that there are online education programs, such as Zearn, IXL, and Edgenunity that are being suggested for students. These are accessible on smartphones, if a laptop is not available.
Chromebooks . . .

Maywood School Families,
The following is a message that schools in our ESU-15 region and Southwest Public Health Region have received about the plan for schools moving forward due to COVID-19.
“Southwest Nebraska Health Department (SWNPHD) has been in consultation with state and local partners regarding the expanding COVID-19 pandemic. It is a public health department recommendation that public . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Moving Forward: March 26th, 2020--Update

div.p:
MPS Enrichment Packet Exchange: Elementary K-5th grades.
We will be meeting on Thursday evenings to swap out enrichment packets to get completed work back to the teachers and new material out to the students. We will be running four different meeting places: Maywood, Curtis, Wellfleet, and North Platte.
All student packets can be picked up on Thursdays from 7:00 AM-4:00 PM at the front door of the high . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Enrichment Packet Exchange

div.p:
MPS Students and Families,
We wanted to remind everyone that the front page of our school website has a list of most often used links for our educational programs. Most students are well versed in knowing how to find the links and access the information. One of the benefits of using cloud-based programs is that students can log in on any device and use the program. That's also one of the benefits of using Gmail/Google Docs, . . .

Maywood School Families,
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic and the force of school closure, Maywood Public Schools will still be offering breakfast and lunch for students. If you would like to have breakfast and/or lunch delivered to your residence, contact the school one day prior to delivery, by 1:00 PM . There will not be choices, the cooks will prepare the meal and it will be delivered. When you . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Breakfast and Lunch Offering
